The person providing assistance must not be grossly negligent or reckless. 3. The assistance must not be intended to cause harm or exacerbate the situation.  In summary, good Samaritan laws aim to encourage people to provide assistance in emergency situations, without fear of legal repercussions, and protect those who act in good faith and with reasonable care.
